thread.title: Inside FIFA case: How Blatter, Platini could face long bans
thread.title_full: Inside FIFA case: How Blatter, Platini could face long bans - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Rob Harris, Ap Sports Writer
title: Inside FIFA case: How Blatter, Platini could face long bans
text: Photo: Christophe Ena, AP FILE - In this Dec. 16, 2014 file photo FIFA president Sepp Blatter, right, and UEFA president Michel Platini talk before the semi final soccer match between Real Madrid and Cruz Azul at the Club World Cup soccer tournament in Marrakech, Morocco. On Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 file photo FIFA provisionally banned President Sepp Blatter and UEFA President Michel Platini for 90 days. FILE - In this Dec. 16, 2014 file photo FIFA president Sepp... ZURICH (AP) — FIFA investigators are yet to be convinced there was any long-standing verbal agreement that led to Sepp Blatter secretly sanctioning the payment of 2 million Swiss francs (about $2 million) to Michel Platini. FILE - In this Dec. 16, 2014 file photo FIFA president Sepp Blatter, right, and UEFA president Michel Platini talk before the semi final soccer match between Real Madrid and Cruz Azul at the Club World Cup soccer tournament in Marrakech, Morocco. On Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 file photo FIFA provisionally banned President Sepp Blatter and UEFA President Michel Platini for 90 days. FILE - In this Dec. 16, 2014 file photo FIFA president Sepp... ZURICH (AP) — FIFA investigators are yet to be convinced there was any long-standing verbal agreement that led to Sepp Blatter secretly sanctioning the payment of 2 million Swiss francs (about $2 million) to Michel Platini.
